intro: Dodecatheon cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist woodlands and stream banks, preferring partial to full shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dodecatheon cordatum is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like buttercups and clematis.
